website_summaries.verdict: Those desiring a lightweight option for 3 season weather will find their match in this mummy-style bag.
pros: Option to purchase for child or adult
Includes stuff sack for easy storage
cons: Many customers warn that is bag is meant for higher temperatures than 20°F - 30°F, if you want a comfortable night's sleep

customer_reviews.title: Compresses well if you have a compression sack
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and super light weight. I was a little skeptical that I would stay warm at night because it seemed a little thin, but I ended up unzipping about 18" of the bag at night. The inside material is beautifully comfortable to the skin. It comes in a stuff sack, and is a decent size on it's own. I bought a Small sized Nelson-Rigg Compression sack, and I recommend that as well for this bag. It gets this back down to the size of a cantaloupe.
customer_reviews.author: Potty training mom

customer_reviews.title: If money is no object, you can find better.  If you are backpacking on a budget, you can't find much better than this.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these for my daughter and I to take on a 4 day backpacking trip through Rocky Mountain National Park. Spent 3 nights on the trail where the temps dropped to the low 40s. Granted, the temps were well above the survivability rating for the bags, but I could easily see pushing lower temps when dressed property. They packed up nicely and were noticeably light weight. They are not the warmest or lightest on the market, but for the budget backpacker, they were exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Good Scout bag
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my son who is in boy scouts. Tested it out at low 40's and said he was warm. It is very light weight for the temp rating, which will also serve well for back packing trips. Have not tested yet at lower range temps but will get a chance this summer in the Sierra's which get in the 30's at night. So far so good, a great bag for his needs and a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Bag
customer_reviews.text: I have used this bag on a few camping trips. It stuffs nicely into my backpack and kept me warm and toasty at night in the North Georgia mountains. I did use a bag liner made from an old sheet because I get cold easily and a liner is easy to wash. The bag is comfortable with a little bit of room to move around (I'm 5'4" 127lbs) inside. The zippers work well and the hood was comfortable although I have not had to pull it closed. I highly recommend this bag for casual campers and think it might work well for someone who would use it even more than I do.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nowhere near 30 degrees
customer_reviews.text: They say rule of thumb is to purchase a sleeping bag rated ten degrees lower than the lowest temp you expect when camping. We bought two of these and took them backpacking In Yosemite where the nights went down to the 40s — we froze all night, even with sleeping pads and thermals. It’s as if they slapped their rating on this bag without any testing. I am super disappointed and will try to return them. I would not recommend these unless it’s 50+ degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Lola

customer_reviews.title: Good, lightweight 40°F bag
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'8", 175 lbs and very cold-natured. I used this in a tent with a hanging thermometer reading 40°F. It was cooler outside. I purposely was in only underwear and a light shirt to test out this bag, but was on a good sleeping pad. I was pretty cold. After putting on thermals, socks, and a beanie I was comfortable and slept well. The "scout" sized bag was snug for sure. There's not a lot of room for a liner in there. I would be real hesitant to use this in 20°F unless I had an outer shell of some kind.
customer_reviews.author: Cheepshooter

customer_reviews.title: Always love the Teton brand
customer_reviews.text: Always love the Teton brand. We have a Scout3400 backpack and this will fit in the sleeping bag compartment, but it's tough to get in. I'm thinking a compression bag would definitely help.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Swenson

customer_reviews.title: Great for backpacking. Weight and size are amazing.
customer_reviews.text: Even as a 5'6 180 pound female this scout sleeping bag is great. In low 40s pouring rain this sleeping bag kept me very warm and comfortable. I feel very secure in bringing on my 20 degree hike in November. The size this sleeping bag gets to is just amazing. It fits in my Teton backpack perfectly. Extremely light weight. The only reason I rank this a 4 is the bottom zipper came loose first time getting into it and Ive now stitched it. Its unfortunately unuseable unless i remove the stitching, but it works for me since itll be so cold Id rather make sure it stays closed. Be careful with your zippers. Otherwise great sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Giddins

customer_reviews.title: Good starter hiking bag ....
customer_reviews.text: I've used this on three hiking trips so far, and it's dropped as low at 28. The bag has performed great (even my feet stayed warm). The fit is "snug", but not bad. I'm 6ft, 230lbs, and had room to move around a little. As far as any cons: It's a little heavier than some of the other bags for hiking, but for the price, you can't beat it. I also don't like the left handed zipper, but that isn't a reason not to buy this bag.
customer_reviews.author: B&H Hoover

customer_reviews.title: Stays Dry After Non-Stop Downpour
customer_reviews.text: This is a great budget bag. Went out on my first backpacking trip and it poured down rain for four straight hours soaking nearly everything in my bag. Even stuff I had in plastic bags got wet. This sleeping bag was cinched up tight and it was dry. I couldn’t believe it. My brothers bag was soaked and most of my other items in similar bags were wet. This could have saved my butt if it would have gotten cold out. As a 6ft 250lbs guy (writing from my wife’s account) it was long enough but pretty snug. Hopefully if I lose weight it will be more comfortable. Overall definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Be Prepared to FREEZE In This Bag!
customer_reviews.text: I got my Teton trailhead 20F ultralight sleeping bag 2 days before hiking into the Trinity Alps on 9/17/2016. The weather was great. Low 40's to high 30's at night.. I literally FROZE in this bag. I had 3 layers of clothes on and still froze. I might as well have been wrapped in a paper napkin. Unless you are camping in the summer and don't need any actual warmth, I would not suggest buying this bag. I'll keep it for the grand kids to sleep on the floor INSIDE the house when they come visit but that's it. It was a terrible waste of money ... and made for a horribly long 3 night hunting trip!
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Great sleepingbag
customer_reviews.text: I just finished a 4 night backpacking trip! I used my new Teton Sleepingbag! I love everything about it! The material was very comfortable and the rating of the sleeping bag was perfect for fall weather. I slept in boxers and it got to 40 degrees at night, I was perfectly warm. The rating is up to 20 degrees, so I’m sure if I wore long jons or sweats during 30s or 20s I would be fine. I just told my friend I was going to write a review when I got home from this trip! Very pleased with this product!
customer_reviews.author: John J

customer_reviews.title: Keeps your warm but not for those over 6ft tall
customer_reviews.text: Tested it down to about the mid 30s and it kept me warm enough. Lightweight and compact, good for hiking motorcycle camping. Zippers seem fairly rugged and did not catch on the material often. My only complaint is if your over 6ft tall, your not going to fit well, especially if you have long arms, its going to be quite cramped.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Hammond

customer_reviews.title: I love this bag!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great sleeping bag for a great price! I took this sleeping bag on a backpacking trip in the Grand Canyon where the temperatures dropped to the 30's (F) and I was hot wearing only long underwear. I spilled some water on it and the water rolled right off due to the waterproof layer applied to the fabric. It has a pocket on the inside for small items such as a cell phone or flashlight to keep them handy. When in the stuff sack, it fit perfectly in the straps on my backpack and I hardly noticed a difference in weight with it attached. I love this sleeping bag and will be getting one for my girlfriend.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed not made for muscular men
customer_reviews.text: Well it was a struggle to give this 3 stars but here’s a huge reason. I’m a muscular guy so this would not fit me. Way to small for my shoulders. So moving around was a struggle. I let my niece sleep in it and she loved it. Told me she wanted so I gave it to her. Her experience is yes very much more positive than mine. I was looking forward to taking this on many adventures but it looks like I’m back in the market for a sleeping bed which is made for muscular men.
customer_reviews.author: Tru

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for 30F+ degrees
customer_reviews.text: The important thing to remember about any sleeping bag is the rating is for survivability, not necessarily comfort. That said, this worked well for a recent 60-hour field operation with temperatures just above freezing. Plus, i can’t get over how lightweight and small it compacts to.
customer_reviews.author: CF

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works Great. I really like my TETON Sport TrailHead +20F Ultralight Sleeping bag. I compress this bag in a Alps Mountaineering Compression Stuff Sack and it compresses down to about the size of a coffee can. This bag works good for me and I'm 6'0 and 225 lbs. It works good to around 30F if you are like me and cannot stand to sleep in long pants, but put the bag in a bivy and gain a few more degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Backwoods

customer_reviews.title: Quality and comfort
customer_reviews.text: I've been slowly updating all my gear as it makes their last trips and I've needed a new sleeping bag for a slightly larger seasonal range than my current bag. I've just received this Teton sleeping bag and love it. It's so warm and all the described features are great quality. I can't wait to put this to the rest on my next trip. It says yellow in the description and looks like yellow in the photographs, but in person it's more orange and I like orange more so that works out for me, but just a heads up if that matters. Happy hiking!
customer_reviews.author: mphaff

customer_reviews.title: Impressed, but really small
customer_reviews.text: I was totally impressed by the material and how such a thin material keeps you so warm. However, at 6'0" and 185 lbs., I was not able to fully zip up the bag. I had to leave the top 2 ft of the zipper open. I successfully used this bag for a 14-day high adventure trek at Philmont Scout Ranch. To work around the size issue, I rotated the bag 90 deg on my body with the zipper down...thus treating the top half of the bag as a blanket.
customer_reviews.author: tth

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner bag.
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is a pretty good buy. It's very warm and the material doesnt get uncomfortable at night. It's pretty easy to zip up, but unfortunately only comes in a few sizes. Fortunately the hiking has allowed me to lose weight, so it's getting a little easier to fit in it. Definitely a great purchase if you are getting into backpacking, hiking and camping. It's not at all over priced and will get you though pretty chilly nights.
customer_reviews.author: rodrigo

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, but NOT a 20o bag.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bag with the understanding it is a 20o F rated bag, meaning I would survive at 20o F. I spent last week on Isle Royale (June 8-13th, 2015), freezing my unmentionables off. The weather did not drop below 40o each night, and I slept in a three-sided wooden shelter nearly every night. If it were not for the comfort of the material used in the bag this would have been a one star review. I am terribly disappointed in the bag's inability to keep me warm and will only be using it for late summer camping. Purchase only if you plan to do the same.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Edward Richmond II

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent sleeping bag and I would most certainly recommend it
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent sleeping bag and I would most certainly recommend it, just don't expect to be winter camping with it. And definitely do not use this in 20 degree Fahrenheit weather. The first time I used, it was low-mid 40s at night. This bag combined with a closed cell foam pad in a tent kept me comfortable until the middle of the night. I woke up pretty chilly. The comfort temp of this bag is probably somewhere around 50-55F. The bag is priced reasonably, light, made of decent material, and can be compressed extremely well for backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: Soft, long and light
customer_reviews.text: 83inches by 24inches (middle) gives a 6'1", 180lb male great room to stretch out length-wise and still have bag under your head-arms. Although, included carrying case is flimsy, the bag seems well stitched and durable considering how light-weight and warm it is. Zipper does not zip down fully to release your feet but, it is not overly tight (I wear size 12" shoes and plenty of room for footsies to rub). Doesn't seem waterproof and material is very soft (but well stitched). Rolls up soft and small (weight and specs as advertised). Great for your backpack
customer_reviews.author: Frest0n

customer_reviews.title: False claims for temperature rating
customer_reviews.text: I started getting cold with this bag around 45°F. The temperature dropped to 38°F and stayed there all night, and I was miserable in this sleeping bag. Their claim of 20°F is completely false advertising. The only way this sleeping bag will keep you warm when it's 20°F outside is if you're snug inside a heated hotel room. This bag is probably fine above 45°F if you are wearing layers.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great Value! Great Bag!
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag is fantastic! My son is transitioning from Cub Scouts to Boy Scouts and I bought this for him for his first BS camp out along with a pack and inflatable pillow. It is a great bag! Perfect for a young Boy Scout!
customer_reviews.author: Steve Doriocourt

customer_reviews.title: but it's great for 40
customer_reviews.text: I would not use it for 20 degrees, but it's great for 40. My son loves this sleeping bag and it is his go-to bag now. It's gone camping many times, including our yearly week long family tent camping trip, it's just what he wanted. Two years , 8 trips, 8 washings later, it's still warm and fluffy.
customer_reviews.author: Delina Storm

customer_reviews.title: Good bag for the price
customer_reviews.text: Overall a great product. Been on a couple of campouts with this, and keeps me toasty warm. Foot area is large enough so I can keep my feet separated. The only two things that I would like to see improved is the hood (it doesn't actually cover much more than the top of my head, which pretty much forces me to wear a knit cap on cold nights) and it would be great if it came with a compression sack (I ended up buying a Nelson-Rigg CB-01-SM Small Compression Bag).
customer_reviews.author: Tired Poppy

customer_reviews.title: not very warm down to 20 degrees
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Great for budget backpacking, good for three to four seasons depending on your climate, is very light for the temperature rating, and is very easy to pack up with the included stuff sack. Cons: Does not work well at 20 degrees and in my experience only works good down to 35 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Michigan Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great early season sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: Just got back from a Blacktail Deer hunt on Prince of Wales Island Alaska. Bag did well at keeping me warm on overnight trips in the alpine. The bag is compact and light for the pack up. The only thing is that it is not wide enough for me to be able to zip up around me. I am pretty Broad at the shoulders and this bag was too small for me . But otherwise a great bag.
customer_reviews.author: Voggy Mtn.

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping bag, warm in cold weather
customer_reviews.text: My first bag had a broken zipper which sucked to find out while camping. It was replaced through Amazon easily and I got a second bag. I got the chance to use that for camping in an unheated RV where overnight temps got into the upper 30s outside. I was really surprised with how well the bag performed. It was cold as I got ready for bed but as soon as I got into the sleeping bag I was instantly warm and stayed warm all night. I used it 3 nights in those conditions and was never cold.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: small and thin
customer_reviews.text: I got the Scout version. I'm 5'1" but the hood would barely come over my head. It's also a very tight fit, too claustrophobic feeling. Seems very thin. Because of it's size and thinness, it was not suitable for me, so I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic night's rest and best bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: Cozy, Soft, Roomy. I'm 5'7 athletic build and I love sleeping in this. Warm and breathable.. I've even gone ahead and orders the LEEF 0 degree F for winter camping. If i had to find 1 area that could use improvement, i'd say the small velcro tab near face opening could be upgraded to a better hook-and-loop type to prevent scuffs if you forget to close it.
customer_reviews.author: DefMonkeh

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag on a Budget
customer_reviews.text: I used this bag for two nights in Bryce Canyon National Park. The first night the temperatures were in the low 40s and I was fine - not toasty warm - but fine wearing long underwear and a hat. The second night temperatures dropped into the high 30s and I was very cold, even though I wore an added puffy coat. I wasn't shivering but I couldn't sleep for being cold. For the price this is a great bag - but if the temps will really be at 40 or under this bag might not perform for cold sleepers.
customer_reviews.author: R. Braun

customer_reviews.title: Cold spots everywhere!
customer_reviews.text: When even on a 50 degree night, while wearing thermal base layers and a fleece jacket, I woke up cold, I knew something was amiss. When I first lay down, I shouldn’t feel cold spots all throughout the bag. But that’s what happened to me on a backpacking outing. Disappointed to say the least, considering the super low temp rated bag from Teton I have is amazing. Would not suggest this to anyone looking on going somewhere remotely cool. Also the zippers. If idiotsfightingthings were filming me trying to zip this thing up, they’d have a few solid hours of entertainment.
customer_reviews.author: Jublin

customer_reviews.title: The material on the inside of the bag was comfortable and it seems quite durable
customer_reviews.text: The material on the inside of the bag was comfortable and it seems quite durable, but it is pretty narrow and the velcro at the top is really annoying. It was stabbing me in the face all night. The zipper doesn't seem like it's going to hold up very long and it let cold air in pretty easily. On the plus side, the bag is compact and fit fine in my backpack with a hammock, small tarp, and other small gear.
customer_reviews.author: Alie

customer_reviews.title: A really good sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: If youre unsure of which bag with what temp to buy then I would suggest this one. This particular +20F bag is just right. Not too hot, not too cold. Could be a tiny bit wider (I'm 6ft with fairly broad shoulders), but I still fit in and feel cozy just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Ist

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size and warmth for my needs
customer_reviews.text: As a 5'3'' petite female, I found this sport size to work perfectly for me. The normal adult size was way over my head and too baggy for my liking but this size was snug while still allowing me a bit of wiggle room. And it has the advantage of being less weight and volume for backpacking trips or taking on an airplane. I was quite warm sleeping in 40F outside at night with a sleeping pad. Haven't tested at temperatures lower than that, though I tend not to camp when it's colder than that anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Ok for the price for warm weather camping. Not recommended under 45 degrees. Zipped are cheap. I did not head the warnings about being tall (6'1) 220lb and I am very tight in it.
customer_reviews.author: Badger

customer_reviews.title: Great for backpacking
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a lightweight option for backpacking. It performed well and packs down small. Kept me plenty warm in the cold 30 degree night temps in the mountains of Wyoming. Zipper system is pretty good and I can't wait to use it again! I am a 5'-10" 220lb Male and this thing fit me perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Beau

customer_reviews.title: Great starter sleeping back for backpacking
customer_reviews.text: Great starter sleeping back for backpacking. It’s on the heavy side though, but you get what you pay for. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Breanna Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: Decent sleeping bag but zipper already broke after one camp out
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son for a school camp out. Price is good since we didn't want to buy a REI bag for one camp out. However, the zipper broke after one use. The top zipper slider dislocated from one side of the zipper and there is no way to get it back on. The return period is already over with Amazon and I will attempt to contact the manufacturer. However, their warranty states that consumer is responsible for the return shipping and with this bag so cheap, it's not worth shipping it back to them. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: F Lam

customer_reviews.title: Good bag, bit small
customer_reviews.text: At 6'3", medium frame, the bag isn't quite big enough to be comfortable for me, but it's my Summer bag so sleeping with my arms out or with it partially unzipped is okay. I thought I'd prefer the softer felt-like material on the inside, but after using it a few times, I'm not so sure. I definitely love the lighter weight and the smaller packed-down size of this bag. I used it at SAREX in Kings Canyon in September, and up in the Sierra before that, and on a handful of other small camping trips. I've been happy with it overall, but I wish it were cut a bit larger for us mutant-sized folks.
customer_reviews.author: associatedtechs

customer_reviews.title: Overall, not horrible
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for bike traveling. It fits on my front fork just fine, which was what I needed. It's a little bulkier then a normal minimalist bag but it worked for my purpose. It's very narrow. It's a struggle to get settled for the night. The shoulders area is very narrow. It's really hard to get zipped all the way up too, which often leads to a draft. Warmth wise, I have to use a liner even down to about 40 and I still get cold. It's serving it's purpose but I'm on the lookout for another bag.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Kandiko

customer_reviews.title: Quality that exceeds price, only slightly.
customer_reviews.text: This is tight for a 5'11 250lb man, it's really more of a Youth size and I'll be getting a larger one ASAP. The quality is there, and a 5'4 woman of average frame would find this perfect. Especially for the weight. However, it's tight on me, it's a tight squeeze, I know I'm going to bust a seam because I'm too large for it, and I wish they called this a "Youth/Small Adult" size instead of whatever they called it.
customer_reviews.author: P. Gupta

customer_reviews.title: A great bag for the price.
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice, lightweight bag that fits easily in my backpack. I've used it several times in 40 degree weather and had no issues with being comfortably warm. Although I have not used it by itself in 20 degree weather I did use it in combination with a fleece blanket and a few hand warmers and was comfortably warm the entire night. I don't know that I would want to be in 20 degree weather with just this bag as it does seem a bit thin for such weather. My only con for this pack is that I wish it had a compression sack. It packs up fairly small but could easily be smaller with the right size compression sack.
customer_reviews.author: Krys Allokard

customer_reviews.title: One of the best sleeping bags for the money I've ever purchased.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this in a tent that literally had a layer of ice built up on the exterior and stayed warm all night long. I've used it in a hammock as a sleeping bag and a top quilt and stayed warm the entire night. I would and have recommend this product to people and I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Darin R.

customer_reviews.title: Great Budget Option.
customer_reviews.text: For a low-price synthetic backpacking bag this is a good sleeping bag. It is not top of the line by any means, but it is also not horribly cheap either. If you are looking for a budget bag to get you started this is a great option. Zippers aren't the greatest but work well enough. I'm 5'11" 200#s and this fits me fine, but a couple inches in any direction and it may not fit so well. Just something to consider.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great, simple bag
customer_reviews.text: I'm a female, 5'6", 130 lbs and I fit in this perfectly. Its super lightweight and feels very warm. If I'm going on a cooler night I'll probably bring my bag liner for a little more warmth, as I haven't actually tested it in the field yet, but when I got into it in my living room to try it out, I was nice and toasty after just a couple seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica E

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for backpacking at a very good price
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, lightweight and pretty small once packed for a 20F. I slept at 28F with a base layer and I was fine, but I would not try to go below this temperature. I also have the Leef 20F which is probably warmer and more resistant, but also heavier and bigger once packed. Backpackers, watch Teton’s videos on YouTube to have a good idea of the size. Overall, excellent for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia

customer_reviews.title: OK bag for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a medium grade bag. It's warm and comfortable. I've used it a couple times and have just a few small complaints. 1. I find it hard to zip the bag from the inside. And if you get it zipped, a little bit of pressure caused the bag to unzip! 2. It's snug in the shoulders. I'm 6', 185 lbs and it's snug around the shoulders. If you're larger framed then me, I wouldn't recommend this bag.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son going into scouts. It's nice and compact, comfortable and warm. I love the fact that it has a lifetime warranty. I'm looking forward to seeing how it holds up over the years. Update: liked it so much I bought myself the full size version. I'm a big guy (6'3", 250lb) and I fit snugly but comfortably. It's nice and warm.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: Good, lightweight sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: I've only gotten to use this bag in about 40 degrees F. I was perfectly warm, but I think I'd have to wear a layer or two at 20 degrees. I'm 5'8, 190 and I fit well in it. One negative - Zipper gets snagged around the shoulders pretty easily... Definitely not the easiest zipping bag I've ever had. The bag seems well made, stuffs easily into my pack or the included stuff sack. I'll give updates as I use it more.
customer_reviews.author: Herbie W.

customer_reviews.title: Does not keep you warm at all , @ 40 F
customer_reviews.text: I used it on Appalachian trail last weekend, April 20. It was not too cold over the night. Weather station said low of 48F. Say its little bit colder on the mountain, but definitely around high 30s. Anyways, I was practically freezing in this bag. My cheap other brand bag would keep me much warmer.
customer_reviews.author: Dagistan

customer_reviews.title: Tight, tight, tight
customer_reviews.text: I am not a big guy, just 5'8" and not heavy either - but I was barely able to zip myself into this bag and, unless you sleep only on your back, you CANNOT move or turn over. Well constructed, too bad they designed it to fit runway models.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew R. West

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag has marked a before and after. It is insane comfortable. I used it down to 4C (39 in American units) and it keeps you warm alright. It folds quite small and weights very little. For those who are interested, it fits the lower compartment of the Teton Sports Scout 3400.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriela

customer_reviews.title: Bought six kept none
customer_reviews.text: Major disappointment. Rated to 20 degrees but must mean Celsius. Thought at that rating would surely be adequate at 43 degrees in Yellowstone in June. Found myself putting on full clothing in middle of night, still shivering, and so cramped from all the clothes was not very happy. Did find customer service outstanding as they replaced a bag that had ripped at zipper without hassle. It is an ok summer bag for backpacking but if can afford buy something of better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Miracle Man

customer_reviews.title: I love this sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: So soft and warm. I love this sleeping bag. Keeps me nice and warm in 30 degree weather. Havent tested it below that yet.
customer_reviews.author: Misha LeeTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: 45 Degree Bag
customer_reviews.text: If you decide to use this bag at anything under 45 deg you will turn into Jack Frost. I tried on several different occasions to give it its just deserve and to no avail did it keep me warm under 45 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Bosch

customer_reviews.title: Zipper issue... Otherwise, nice bag
customer_reviews.text: The good: comfy, warm, lightweight, well-sewn lining, fits easily into stuff sack without rolling. Just what I wanted! The bad: the zipper jammed on first use... Even though I had read about that in past reviews and tried to be very careful! It was summer, so the parts of me that weren't exposed stayed warm, but this would ruin a camping trip in cooler weather. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: goddess

customer_reviews.title: I love Teton Products.
customer_reviews.text: THESE BAGS DO NOT COME WITH COMPRESSION SACKS. Other than that, they're great for the price which seems to be Teton's mission. I tried mine out on a 40 degree night wearing a t-shirt and shorts on top of an insulated pad and I was pretty uncomfortable. I wasn't shivering but I was definitely cold. I probably would have been OK wearing proper clothing but I was hoping the bag could keep me warm. Great 3-season bag.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: perfect sleeping bag for scouts
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag was perfect for my son's boy scout overnight outings during the early spring.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This kept me warm
customer_reviews.text: My backpacking mate had a thicker/larger/heavier bag and they were miserable all night in nearly freezing temps. I didn't mind it at all while in this bag. I could feel the cold creeping up from the ground, I didn't have a pad or anything, but it was still plenty comfortable for me. This also fits well in the amazon basics hiking backpack.
customer_reviews.author: leenyx

customer_reviews.title: Good for what it is
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for motorcycle touring, is a 40 degree bag, can't see it being used in much colder temps. I'm a big guy, wide shoulders, and this works, not roomy, but it works, and the price can't be beat. Well constructed, the only thing I'd really like to see changed is for it to include a compression stuff sack. The sack that it comes with can be tossed in the trash for all the good it is. Past that, a good value all in all.
customer_reviews.author: Marshall Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Another winner from TETON Sports
customer_reviews.text: Got this after getting tired of lugging around my 5 degree TETON bag all the time. This one is about half the weight and half the size packed. Still warm and cozy and well made. The zipper is a little finicky just like my 5 degree bag. It gets caught up on the sleeping bag shell pretty easily. For the price and weight, these TETON bags are hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer B.

customer_reviews.title: which is a good thing since I tend to sleep cold - I ...
customer_reviews.text: Warmer than I thought it would be, which is a good thing since I tend to sleep cold - I decided on this one anyway because I really only need a one-season sleeping bag at this point. It will definitely do that job and could probably be a good three-season sleeping bag. Soft and snuggly.
customer_reviews.author: GNMJ

customer_reviews.title: Very light but well built, great for hike camping
customer_reviews.text: Well built and zippers are sturdy. It's a little narrower by the feet than I was expecting. I'm 5'7, 180 pounds and fit comfortably but it is only slightly wider than I am lying down. But that's what you get with the "mummy" style design I guess. Very light so we use it while we hike and the weight aspect of it is probably worth it alone. I looked for the lightest sleeping bag for the best price and this seems to be it
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Chernochan

customer_reviews.title: Great Sleeping Bag
customer_reviews.text: This bag is a great bag for the price. I used this camping when the temp. dipped into the 30s and I was perfectly warm in just a t-shirt and shorts. Very compact and roomy. Packs really easy into the included stuff sack, and fits perfectly into my backpack. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Chris J.

customer_reviews.title: Works OK
customer_reviews.text: 20 degrees is VERY generous. I guess 20 is survivable in this bag, but it is definitely not comfortable. Was down to 45 degrees and it was very chilly. Had to wear socks and long underwear. Zipper would not stay up. Slightest move and the bag would open. Not bad, just annoying.
customer_reviews.author: paul conley

customer_reviews.title: ... heavy clothes also not very tall for saying its good for 70 plus inches zipper is difficult also
customer_reviews.text: no way in hell it is getting down to 20 degrees Fahrenheit about 50 would be comfy and maybe 40 with heavy clothes also not very tall for saying its good for 70 plus inches zipper is difficult also. but if you are small and not going for padding or under 40 degrees this will be a good purchase it does roll up easy and that is with out a compression sack definitely need a pad to go under it if you plan on outside sleeping. the klymit or what not even though it is blow up yourself I liked that pad.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small, light and warm.
customer_reviews.text: Only giving 4 stars as I havent camped with this yet. But its a great bag so far. Its roomy enough to be comfortable (mind you I am 5'5" and 135 lbs) but packs really small. I have a Teton scout 3400 backpack and this fits in the sleeping bag picket with room to spare. I dont have it in a compression sack either. I like that its light. My fully loaded pack with this bag, tent, pad, clothes, food and full gear is just 32 lbs. Im happy that I can finally carry my sleeping bag as the last one I weighed was 8 pounds. That was not gonna happen.
customer_reviews.author: homeschoolmom5Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Too small for 5'4" and 180lbs but still warm
customer_reviews.text: I got this because someone said they were 5'4" and fit fine. I fit, sure, but my feet were squished at the bottom and I couldnt burrow inside at all to get my face warm. Also my head barely fit in the cinching part of the top. But my body was warm on a 40 degree night so i will be returning for the adult size. I want room to wiggle just a little, add a liner, and be able to layer up.
customer_reviews.author: Audra

customer_reviews.title: Little Uzi
customer_reviews.text: Got this bag, tent and Scout backpack. This bag fits in the 3400 backpack, like nothing. Honestly, if you're trying to get all new shtuff for camping this stuff is great. Way lighter weight than I expected. I'm a real person, any rapper with "lil" in their name right now is garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Brown

customer_reviews.title: Best Deal For Lightweight Hikers!
customer_reviews.text: Have used these with a fellow hiker and had to get some myself! Very lightweight and easy to roll and place in your pack! These are the best for keeping warm on the trail! They take awhile to trap the heat and you may be cold the first 30 minutes and may shiver a bit during the night if you're a big chilly kiddo like myself, but these babies keep that warmth in! Have had to unzip these a few times due to the heat when on trips! Definetly worth your money!
customer_reviews.author: Aubree Hesley

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't fit any adult
customer_reviews.text: Bought this sleeping bag for its length as my 16 yr old son is pretty tall. But he couldn't even come close to zipping it up. I tried it (I am 5'4") and I couldn't zip it up. Even my daughter who weighs 120 lbs said it was very tight zipped up. I don't know who could ever fit in it. It is also very thin. I used it as a blanket since I couldn't zip it up but in 55 deg weather I was cold. Unfortunately I didn't get to try it until after the return period.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: NOT a compression sack
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Great overall value. Materials are pretty high quality and it it kept me pretty comfy overnight in my hammock (40F) Cons: Despite the description, the bag that it comes in is not a compression sack which is a bummer. Also, it’s quite snug - I’m 5’11” athletic build, 46 chest with a size 12 foot and the shoulders and foot box are snug.
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: A little too good to be true.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time in good condition at an affordable price for a lighter weight and fairly compact sleeping bag. Used it the first time in 30 degree Fahrenheit weather and found it to be fairly cool throughout but there was a cold spot on my right knee. Ended up using a liner to make it through the night. I plan on keeping it but won’t count on it below 40 degrees. In the end, you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Ron E.

customer_reviews.title: Nice materials, comfortable bag
customer_reviews.text: Nice materials, comfortable bag, but no where near a 20 degree bag. Wife felt cold on a 45 degree night, so we traded bags... I was cold on the next night at 40 degrees with a blanket on top. I would only use this in very mild weather. We had to return it. Thankfully Amazon made this very easy.
customer_reviews.author: ~FM~

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect bag for summer camping- can’t wait to try it in the fall. Price was perfect for a great quality product. Read a ton of reviews on this and others - glad I settled on this one!
customer_reviews.author: Angela Lentine

customer_reviews.title: Nice sleeping bag; I wouldn't go down to 20F in it though, maybe 35F.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my needs. These were for my kids. I don't see this holding up to 20-30 degrees, but maybe 35, which is still pretty cold and not hit at night during the months i take my kids backpacking. I wist it came with a storage sack, and i did buy compression stuff sacks to help it fit better in the sleeping compartment of a 40L backpack, but it did squeeze in with just the sack it came with.
customer_reviews.author: Clinton David Hague

customer_reviews.title: It will keep you nice and toasty on those cold nights on the trail
customer_reviews.text: It will keep you nice and toasty on those cold nights on the trail. The two drawbacks 1. needs a pull added on the inside of the bag to zip up (very difficult to zip all the way from inside the bag) 2. It's a little tight... no room to move or turn. I'm not a big guy by any stretch, but felt a little more closed in than with other bags of the same style.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Not a 20 degree bag
customer_reviews.text: I am only rating this a 3 because of the temp rating. I wouldnt rate this bag for anything less than 40 degrees. You will be cold. Above that it is a good lightweight bag for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Darth Vader

customer_reviews.title: Great Sleeping Bag for Moderate Weather
customer_reviews.text: Only used once so far and it worked great. Temperature got down to low 30's and it stayed comfortable - not sure it would work for temps much below that. Very lightweight and fits easily into included stuff sack.
customer_reviews.author: W. J. Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Good sleeping bag!
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this sleeping bag twice, but both times so far it has kept me very warm. One night it was about 50 degree's, and the other was in someones house, but overall, VERY comfy. VERY warm. VERY soft. I love that it zips all the way up so you can cocoon yourself in the warmth. CONS: They literally did not want to give you even an ounce of extra room in the tie bag it comes with. You literally have to wrap that sucker the tightest you've EVER wrapped anything in your life, and even still, I have to use my foot to push it in completely. 4 stars because of the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Great but 2 slight complaints
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a great sleeping bag, it is lightweight and comfortable. However there are two things to note. First, it is kind of small; I am 5'9" 155 lbs and I felt a little cramped in the adult size. Also, it is advertised as rated for 20 degrees F; I just used it for a couple nights that got down into the 30s and I started to get chilly.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Garrido

customer_reviews.title: Good value for warm summer nights.
customer_reviews.text: Although I love this sleeping bag, it did not keep me warm in 40 degree weather. I even added an extra blanket on top, three layers of clothing and still was not warm enough. I am a 5 ft tall, 50 year old female. I've used it in 50 degree weather and it felt perfect. It is a very light and compact-able bag that I purchased for light weight backpacking purposes. Love the color and style and it has some nice features like the foot bed, draft stopper and inside pocket. Good value for warm summer nights.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: What a great bag! Exactly as described.
customer_reviews.text: Very soft feeling interior and quality stitching throughout including the embroidery. Zippers are large and very smooth. I also purchased the ALPS Mountaineering Compression Stuff Sack (SMALL) and this bag fits that sack and compresses down to half of the size of the stuff sack it comes with - if you need it to have a smaller footprint in your pack.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Ells-O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Fits a 5' 1" woman
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a lighter weight smaller bag and I found this option. I fit comfortably in this bag at 5' 1" about 110lbs. It is not claustrophobic feeling, but nice to have a small bag in length, weight, and packed size. I like the little pocket inside and am excited to try it out backpacking next summer.
customer_reviews.author: BBC Fam

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: very disappointed in this bag, rated to 20 degrees, was very cold at 43 degrees, the zipper snagged every time I tried to zip up. wasn't expecting a $500 bag for $55 but this is probably more like a $19 bag that your 12 year would take to as slumber party. cant recommend this bag or any of this companys products
customer_reviews.author: Brent Needham

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly  warm & lightweight sleeping bag!
customer_reviews.text: Went on a 2 day hiking trip in Snoqualmie pass and temps dipped in high 20s at night! This sleeping bank kept me warm! I’m very impressed with the quality! Also, it’s lightweight and you can stuff it back in the bag. You don’t need to roll it up. I just stuffed it back in & it works! This sleeping bag is just as good as very expensive ones! I will be purchasing other Teton products because they have top notch quality products!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice 40 degree bag
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight, packs pretty compactly into its bag, I was able to also stuff in there my inflatable sleeping pad and pillow. Comfy for sure, zipper works well. I would be cautious about using this bag in 20 degree temps. I took it on a backpacking trip in northern MN, temps at night into the low 40's, I was ok but wore my socks and a balaclava to sleep as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jane parker

customer_reviews.title: Great for camping, easy to pack
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and warm. I went hiking when it was 20 degrees outside. Granted I wore multiple layers and a ski mask but I was plenty warm in this sleeping bag. It was lightweight and easy to hike with this on my back. Definitely the best sleeping bag I've ever gotten! The price is very fair for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: KangAndRose

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a lot of experience with sleeping bags but this did work very well in about 40 degrees and windy. I do need to get more used to the mummy style but tho it was snug it wasn't too bad. The top had a drawstring to keep my head warm. I'd buy it again as of now. And I used a compression sack which worked great.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Warm, soft, and comfy!
customer_reviews.text: I've taken this sleeping bag out 4 times so far and every time it has sufficiently warmed me. For a mummy bag, it is pretty spacious. All the features are pretty cool too. The only thing is that I'm not a big fan of the color or the large printing of the temperature type on the side of the bag. The storage bag is really nice and looks cool.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Will not keep you warm if temp is in 40s
customer_reviews.text: We currently used this bag (2 of them) while hiking the AT and temps dropped into the 40s during the night a few times. You will not be warm at all if temps do drop into the 40s. You can feel the cold air coming right through the bag and if there is any wind, you will freeze. The bag works better in mid-50 and up temps. Yes it's a light bag but beware if you're looking to stay warm. Teton will offer you a discount code for your "inconvenience". Take the time to research other bags and spend a little more money. We ended up buying another bag mid hike.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Hyde

customer_reviews.title: Quality made sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: Quality construction, nice texture material, compact size when packed. Trusting the 20 deg rating, it's not bulky or as fluffy/thick as compared to a nice REI mummy bag of mine. It's a mummy bag, narrow and comfortable. Inner lining is soft and microfiber feel, not slick like nylon. Inside pocket keeps valuables safe and handy. Nice color. Good price. Have not slept outdoors in it yet for full review
customer_reviews.author: M. Wei

customer_reviews.title: I'm 5 feet tall and a reasonably good seamstress, and shortened this sleeping bag before using ...
customer_reviews.text: Disclaimer: I'm 5 feet tall and a reasonably good seamstress, and shortened this sleeping bag before using it. It is light and well-constructed. It was warm enough at 40 degrees in dry, still conditions (with layers), but I don't think it would be sufficient at 20 degrees. It's quite soft and comfortable, though. More cost-effective than getting a women's sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: An excellent product. Cool when it's hot
customer_reviews.text: An excellent product. Cool when it's hot, and comforting when it's cold. For a person of 185 cm like me, it is a pleasure to enjoy the outdoors with this sleeping bag. It would be great to be even better at avoiding the condensation of liquids under the body, but other than that a great buy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Orlando Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Great workmanship aside from the small size issue.
customer_reviews.text: The TETON Sports TrailHead says it fits larger Frame but it does not. I am 72" tall and about 22" at the shoulders laying down. I took this sleeping bag out for a three day backpacking adventure and got very cold on a rainy night. Although the sleeping bag materials seem of high quality, I was unable to zip it close around my shoulders as it was too small. When I was able to zip it with a lot of effort, I felt that I was wearing a straight jacket as my shoulders were tightly locked in with my arms wrapped around my chest.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Deceiving temp label
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not a 20 degree bag. 45 is about it's comfort limit. At 37 degrees I was very uncomfortable in this bag. That's not to say it is a bad bag. It's just miss labeled.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Great weight/pack size for the price
customer_reviews.text: Like the pack down size. Wish it came with compression sack instead of stuff sack, but an inexpensive compression sack purchase made it compact to slightly larger than a 32 oz nalgene. It may not keep you snuggly warm down to 20 degrees, haven't tried it that low yet. But it is a warm bag, especially for the weight which is under 3 pounds, and the price, which is under $50. In those price and weight parameters, it can't be beat. This is the second one I have purchased because I was so pleased with the first.
customer_reviews.author: ThriftyMom

product_meta.title: TETON Sports TrailHead Sleeping Bag; Lightweight Camping, Hiking
product_meta.description: Color:Scout Orange| Size:Scout - 75" x 30" x 20"You don’t need to break the bank to get a lightweight, warm and comfortable sleeping bag. The TrailHead Ultralight Sleeping Bag has a soft-to-the-touch liner. The innovative fill makes it easy to pack down into your backpack without sacrificing performance. The footbox is built with extra room for your feet. And it comes with our Lifetime Warranty so you can also be comfortable with your purchase. It’s helping thousands of backpackers and campers stay comfortable in The Great Outdoors.
feature_bullets: FOR THE LOVE OF COMFORT: The innovative fill packs down without sacrificing performance; Roomy footbox; Zipper draft tube; Soft liner provides a comfortable night's sleep
NEVER ROLL YOUR SLEEPING BAG AGAIN: TETON provides a great compression sack for stuffing your sleeping bag; Start at the bottom and stuff the bag in, then tighten the heavy-duty straps
LIGHTWEIGHT AND LOFTY: Lightweight for backpacking, hiking, and camping; Innovative microfiber insulation offers more loft and first-rate compressibility without sacrificing performance
SLEEP WARM: Fluff your sleeping bag and use an insulated camp pad to sleep warmer; Hang loops for long-term storage
TETON SPORTS PROMISE: Reach out to our AMAZING product support team if you have any questions or concerns; YOU CAN COUNT ON US to get you taken care of and back OUTDOORS with TETON Sports

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
